Description: Five links of a gold chain made of thin wires of square cross-section, four of them doubled twisted eight-shaped and one single at one end, drawn out into rounded wire, with a twist at the end.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Tell Dafana, From the denuded surface of the site or the neighbourhood ?
Curator's comments: One of the gold "pieces of chain" mentioned by W.M.F. Petrie, Tanis ii, Nebesheh and Defenneh, p. 76 § 73, "piece of gold chain, a pendant; probably a glass bead lost from end", ibid., p. 110, pl. xli, 18.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (p. 76 § 73, p. 110, pl. xli, 18)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.83, p.84, p.186, pl.28)
